H0.text: Transferring impulses to the appropriate muscle is the activity that illustrates the main function of the motor neuron complex.

H1.text: Receiving sensory impulses from the environment illustrates the main function of the motor neuron complex.

H2.text: Delivering regular impulses to the autonomic system is the activity that illustrates the main function of the motor neuron complex.

H3.text: Processing impulses within the cerebral cortex illustrates the main function of the motor neuron complex.

A4.text: The axons from the lower motor neurons are efferent nerve fibers that carry signals from the spinal cord to the effectors.

A5.text: They are called efferent to indicate the flow of information from the central nervous system (CNS) to the periphery.
